results.title: Life story
results.creator_credit: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Joel Atkinson’s parents split up, his dad took him to Shepparton. Determined to make the most of it, Atkinson worked hard to be a good role model for his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Cousins
results.creator_credit: Helen Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Helen Atkinson believes that family should always be close so you have someone to turn to when you need them the most. She shares a close bond with her cousin and wouldn’t have it any other way.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helen Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.
description_for_label: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.

results.title: My nan
results.creator_credit: Tammy-Lee Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘A nan, a mum, an auntie, a cousin and a friend’. Tammy-Lee remembers her beloved nan, without whom there would’ve been no family.

results.title: Mum and dad
results.creator_credit: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.

results.title: The Great cod fisher woman
results.creator_credit: Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.

results.title: Little Dolly : Shakira
results.creator_credit: Daniel Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel Edwards’ little girl, Shakira, was born with Miller-Dieker syndrome, a congenital disorder. Edwards pays tribute to his late daughter, who he affectionately refers to as ‘Little Dolly’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Daniel Edwards’ little girl, Shakira, was born with Miller-Dieker syndrome, a congenital disorder. Edwards pays tribute to his late daughter, who he affectionately refers to as ‘Little Dolly’.

results.title: Goanna
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Williams’ story is ultimately about empowerment through music. Her uncle, Harry Williams, was a famous Indigenous country musician. Anna tells his story and how his influence and inspiration has helped to empower and heal Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
